title: How to Make a Sto Fen Type Wax Paper Diffuser

steps.headline: Cut a strip of tape, approximately 9 inches (22.9 cm).
steps.description: You will want it to fit around the circumference of the flash. Have the adhesive away from the flash.

steps.headline: Put a piece of paper on the duct tape.
steps.description: This will allow you to adjust the diffuser without having the wax paper sticking to the tape.

steps.headline: Fasten the duct tape around the flash and use scotch tape to temporarily hold it together.
Get a piece of wax paper about six inches square.
Use your intended flash and lightly trace around it so that you know what size you need it to me.
Draw a straight line out from all sides of the shape that you drew on the wax paper.
Cut the corners so that you have four tabs that you will fold over to make the box.
steps.description: The cutout area is shown here with the Xs.

steps.headline: Fold over the tabs so that they meet and tape them.
steps.description: Be sure that it will fit around the flash and that the edges overlap.

steps.headline: Place the wax paper diffuser over the tape that is around the flash.
Be sure that there is about a half inch or more above the duct tape.
steps.description: That is where the diffused light will generate from.

steps.headline: Use the scotch tape to fasten it in the correct place so that it won't move around.
Take a second piece of duct tape and place it on top of the other tape.

text: Cut a strip of tape, approximately 9 inches (22.9 cm). You will want it to fit around the circumference of the flash. Have the adhesive away from the flash. Put a piece of paper on the duct tape. This will allow you to adjust the diffuser without having the wax paper sticking to the tape. Fasten the duct tape around the flash and use scotch tape to temporarily hold it together.  Get a piece of wax paper about six inches square.  Use your intended flash and lightly trace around it so that you know what size you need it to me.  Draw a straight line out from all sides of the shape that you drew on the wax paper.  Cut the corners so that you have four tabs that you will fold over to make the box. The cutout area is shown here with the Xs. Fold over the tabs so that they meet and tape them. Be sure that it will fit around the flash and that the edges overlap. Place the wax paper diffuser over the tape that is around the flash.  Be sure that there is about a half inch or more above the duct tape. That is where the diffused light will generate from. Use the scotch tape to fasten it in the correct place so that it won't move around.  Take a second piece of duct tape and place it on top of the other tape. Sticky edges will go together. Finished.
